verses.roman:
pratigṛhya tu tat sarvaṁ
bhagavān sātvatarṣabhaḥ
sa-sutaḥ sa-snuṣaḥ prāyāt
suhṛdbhir abhinanditaḥ

synonyms: pratigṛhya—accepting; tu—and; tat—that; sarvam—all; bhagavān—the Supreme Lord; sātvata—of the Yādavas; ṛṣabhaḥ—the chief; sa—with; sutaḥ—His son; sa—and with; snuṣaḥ—His daughter-in-law; prāyāt—He departed; su-hṛdbhiḥ—by His well-wishers (the Kurus); abhinanditaḥ—bid farewell.
translation: The Supreme Lord, chief of the Yādavas, accepted all these gifts and then departed with His son and daughter-in-law as His well-wishers bid Him farewell.
